name: Local Stockpiles
desc: Local Stockpiles display a preview of all the stored trade commodities produced or imported. Commodities placed here are absorbed into the colony’s reserves, which are automatically used to support production and prevent shortages. Goods can be withdrawn from the stockpiles by the player. Contributing to the stockpiles helps industries with supply for production.

name: Open Market
desc: The open market. Only legal goods may be traded here, and transactions are subject to tariffs. More goods are available when stability is high. Trade on the open market does not directly influence government stockpiles. Tariffs from all transactions contribute to the colony's budget.

name: Black Market
desc: The black market. Anything and everything can be bought or sold, and there are no tariffs. More goods are available when stability is low. Black market activity does not contribute to government stockpiles or colony revenues. Black market transactions may catch the eye of authorities, resulting in cargo scans and reduced faction standing, unless the trades are carried out with the transponder turned off. Engaging in legitimate trade as a "cover" also reduces the probability of attracting the attention of authorities.

Trade with $theFaction military base. Weapons and other military hardware can be bought and sold here even if they're illegal on the open market. A commission and better standing with $theFaction results in higher-grade hardware being available. Will buy locally illegal goods as part of a no-questions-asked buyback program. Military procurement directly influences the base’s internal inventory.
